circumstances: Damian Clark was last seen at his familiar workplace, a small studio he frequented to recreate art despite his retirement. Known for his tendency to live off-grid, Damian occasionally took solitary retreats without informing anyone. On this occasion, he left a cryptic note hinting at plans to visit 14 East Park, Inchmarlo, and later, a dock in the region, possibly to gather inspiration from nature. Worrisome were his recent remarks on feeling burdensome, suggesting suicidal ideation. Investigators tracked his path from a cemetery near 10 East Cathcart Street to a marina, raising alarms on his whereabouts. Thankfully, Damian was eventually found safe by police at Carmelite Street, Banff.

circumstances: Damian Clark, an 88-year-old retired artist, was last seen at his home on North High Street. Despite his sister's concerns about his wellbeing, Damian was known for living off-grid and often visited local spots alone. On the day he disappeared, he was believed to have headed toward a dock or marina near the workplace he used to frequent. Witnesses reported seeing an elderly man matching his description near a park along Bog Road, AB31 4JU. With familiarity in the area, Damian could have wandered further without alerting anyone. Fortunately, police located him in the early hours near Inchmarlo, unharmed. Although initially deemed high risk due to his age and disability, his condition was stable upon his return.

return_method_desc: Traced by member of the public
circumstances: Damian Clark, an 88-year-old retired artist, was last known to frequent the docks at the marina near Beltie Road, AB31 4JT. Known for living a somewhat off-grid lifestyle, Damian often kept to himself, although he maintained an active presence on social media, posting his art and interacting with followers. In the days leading up to his disappearance, Damian had exhibited signs of suicidal ideation, which concerned his family, especially his sister. On the day he vanished, Damian had left behind cryptic messages online, prompting his family to alert authorities. After being reported missing, he was eventually traced by a member of the public who recognized him wandering aimlessly along Mar Road, Braemar, AB35 5YN. Damian was found unhurt and reunited with his relieved family.

circumstances: Damian Clark, a retired artist, had been exhibiting signs of suicidal ideation over the recent months. His sister became concerned when he failed to show up at a planned visit to his workplace, where he often retreated to focus on painting as a means of coping. Despite the frequent visits from Shaun and check-ins from his colleague, Wendy Bolton, Damian's behavior had become increasingly erratic. On the day he went missing, Damian left his home abruptly, leaving behind personal items that indicated distress. His sister reported him missing after discovering a cryptic note in his studio. Eventually, police traced him to Mar Road, Braemar, as he was contemplating his next steps.
